summary: This document is an email chain from January 2020 among personnel at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY), primarily concerning logistical issues and approvals for international travel to Stockholm, Sweden, for an interview related to the Epstein investigation (case 2018R01618). The emails reveal coordination for travel, disputes over flight refundability and costs, and references to prior domestic travel for the same investigation.

connections.description: M submits travel approval requests to S, who grants them, indicating a supervisor-subordinate or approver-requester working relationship within the U.S. Attorney's Office.

events.title: Planned Travel to Stockholm for Interview
events.description: SDNY prosecutors plan to travel to Stockholm, Sweden, for an interview related to the Epstein investigation. The trip involves flights from JFK to Stockholm via Paris and return.

events.title: Prior Travel to Los Angeles for Interview
events.description: Reference to prior approved travel for the Epstein investigation team to Los Angeles for an interview or interviews.

events.title: Prior Travel to Los Angeles for Interview
events.description: Reference to prior approved travel for an interview in Los Angeles related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Prior Travel to West Palm Beach for Interview
events.description: Reference to prior approved travel for an interview in West Palm Beach, Florida, related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Prior Travel to Los Angeles for Victim Interview
events.description: Reference to prior approved travel to Los Angeles for a victim interview in the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Prior Travel to West Palm Beach for Meetings/Interviews
events.description: Reference to prior approved travel to West Palm Beach, Florida, for meetings and interviews with victims in the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Prior Travel to West Palm Beach for Meetings/Interviews
events.description: Reference to prior approved travel to West Palm Beach, Florida, for meetings and interviews related to United States v. Epstein.

events.title: Initial Travel Request for Epstein Investigation
events.description: Initial travel request for the Epstein investigation (case 2018R01618) for meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale, Florida.

keyFacts: The document confirms active investigation work by the SDNY on the Epstein case (2018R01618) as late as January 2020, including international travel to Sweden for an interview.
The email chain reveals internal logistical friction within the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding booking refundable international flights and communication breakdowns.
Multiple references are made to prior domestic travel for the same investigation to locations like Los Angeles and West Palm Beach for victim interviews and meetings.
The case is formally referenced as 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618, an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity'.
The correspondence shows the investigation involved a team of prosecutors and required formal travel approvals and budget considerations for flights and hotel conference rooms.
